Expectation1: Review and analyze legal documents and contracts
Situation1: A purchase agreement needs analysis before an upcoming filing deadline that is drawing nearer.
Expectation2: Organize and participate in peaceful protests to raise awareness about social issues.
Situation2: Police have just begun to unexpectedly block the exits of the protest area, and you must immediately help coordinate a safe response.
Story: I sat at my desk, the purchase agreement spread out before me, red pen in hand. The filing deadline was tomorrow, and my client was counting on me to catch every loophole, every hidden clause. My phone buzzed, and I glanced at the screen—messages from fellow activists flooded in. The police had started blocking the exits at the protest downtown, and panic was rising. I was supposed to be there, helping coordinate a safe response, making sure no one got hurt. My heart pounded as I weighed the contract in front of me against the urgent calls for help. As a lawyer, I owed my client diligence and focus; as an activist, I owed my friends and the cause my presence and leadership. The clock ticked louder, the demands of both worlds pulling me in opposite directions. I felt the pressure mounting, my mind racing with the consequences of letting either side down.
